etymology.description: Originally 㯥(ㄔ, 'cáo') as two bundles 東(東) (dōng, 'east') -> 囗(囗) added as mark, corrupted to 甘(甘) (gān, 'sweet'), later 曰(曰) (yuē, 'say') in Seal Script -> form 𣍘(𣍘), top merged to 曲(曲) (qū, 'bent') with extra stroke
etymology.interpretation: The character 曹(cáo) evolved from depicting two bundles, indicating partnership or similarity, into a more complex form distinguished by originally unrelated elements.

examples.chinese: 我们在曹(曹)，体验古城风情(體驗古城風情)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zài cáo, tǐyàn gǔchéng fēngqíng.
examples.english: We, at this place, experienced the charm of the ancient city.
